question: What is the official language of Ethiopia?
explanation: Ethiopia is a landlocked country located in Eastern Africa, which forms a part of the Horn of Africa. It shares land borders with six countries such as Eritrea to the north, Djibouti to the northeast, Somalia to the east, Kenya to the south, South Sudan to the west, and Sudan to the northwest. Ethiopian Highlands and its associated Great Rift Valley cover the majority of Ethiopia. Ethiopia is the most popular landlocked country in the world and second-most populous country on the African continent after Nigeria. The capital of Ethiopia is Addis Ababa, which is world-famous as it serves as headquarters for several international organizations such as the African Union, OAU, and UNECA, etc. The official currency of Ethiopia is Ethiopian birr, which is issued by the National Bank of Ethiopia. The official language of Ethiopia is Amharic, spoken by Amhara ethnic group of Ethiopia.
